comment.author: 33142742@N03
comment._content: L.H. Bigelow was captain of the Yale football team in 1907-8: www.thecrimson.com/article/1913/11/22/harvard-and-yale-fo... www.thecrimson.harvard.edu/article/1908/4/1/spring-footba... And later president of the Mitchel College Men's League. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=940DE3DF173DE633A... This photo caught my eye because the backdrop appears to be the same one in this image: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4525453659/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: A Google images search under "Yale Football," "Yale Football Player," and "Yale Football Portrait" turns up a bunch more of these player pix with that backdrop. The backdrop, or a similar one, with a segment of the Yale fence in the foreground, apparently was in use for portraits from the 1890s up into the 1960s.

comment.author: 96179722@N00
comment._content: Captain of the Yale football team and look how tattered his uniform is...in a portrait.  Of all universities, you'd think that one of the Ivy League schools would have better equipment.  But it just drives home the point of how spoiled we are today.  We live in a disposable society where we'd rather throw something away than repair it.  (And I certainly don't exclude myself from that statement.)

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Ah, but he has just left the field after a practice session, and doubtless wants a photo to send back home to New Jersey, to impress his high school sweetheart. The battered duds make him look rugged and heroic. But when you look at his pretty face, you realize that he really doesn't have a scratch on him. [Funny thing, huh? -- the guy was born in New Jersey, but he isn't wearing one!] This is Lucius Horatio "Ray" Bigelow III. Even his name is heroic. Incidentally, it was a tradition at Yale for the team captain to return the following year as the football coach. Bigelow maintained that tradition. Here's a Wikipedia entry for him: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucius_Horatio_Bigelow

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Ron Scheffler and Wystan:

Thanks for the details on Mr. Bigelow. We will expand the descriptive information when we update this record.
